title: Ticket #7320: preen can DOS the schedd
description:
When spool is large, and there are many directories of spooled job data, preen can monopolize the schedd's queue management interface for a long time. Beginning with 8.6.9, it does release the connection every 20 seconds. But it will immediately attempt to make a new connection and keep doing that until it has finished walking the spool directory.

Preen should be changed so that it first walks the spool directory, building a list of 'potentially stale' files mapped by job id. only then should it contact the schedd to get a list of valid job ids, and then proceed to cleanup the files known to be stale. It should use the condor_q v2 query command for this purpose since that does not block the schedd, and it should use only a single query command to get all of the job ids. We should also remove the PREEN_MAX_SCHEDD_CONNECTION_TIME knob, since it will no longer be of use.

If it is unable to query the schedd, it should presume that all job spool directories (those that have valid name patterns) are still in use.

Additional background can be found in this design document.

2019-Oct-22 17:47:08 by coatsworth:
Code Review

[58147] Mostly looks fine. Just a couple nit picks:

preen.cpp:

  • lines 467-521: f2, f3 should be more descriptive variable names
  • line 553: Should be uncommented, we want to see this error
  • line 566: If maybe_stable is empty, both firstid and lastid will equal 0, I think we want to do something different with tmpstr and ad in this case?

2019-Oct-23 13:00:31 by johnkn:
Regarding the notes:

  • lines 467-521: f2 is the filename at level 2 of the directory, f3 is at level three. I will change to fn to indicate filename better, but other than that I think these are good variable names.
  • line 553: uncommenting this dprintf results in the same error message twice in the log.
  • line 566: is unreachable if maybe_stale is empty

2019-Nov-25 15:04:30 by jfrey:
Some more notes:

Beginning in HTCondor 8.6.10, preen scans the entire spool directory before talking to the schedd (#6521), but it then asks the schedd about the existence of individual jobs, with a round trip per query. If the connection to the schedd drops, preen assumes files for all remaining jobs in its list should be deleted.
